citeinfo.origin: USGS Alaska Science Center, 4210 University Drive, Anchorage, Alaska 99508
citeinfo.title: Catalogue of Polar Bear (Ursus maritimus) Maternal Den Locations in the Beaufort Sea and Neighboring Regions, Alaska, 1910 – 2010

descript.abstract: This report presents data on the approximate locations and methods of discovery of 392 polar bear (Ursus maritimus) maternal dens found in the Beaufort Sea and neighboring regions between 1910 and 2010 that are archived by the U.S. Geological Survey, Alaska Science Center, Anchorage, Alaska. A description of data collection methods, biases associated with collection method, primary time periods, and spatial resolution are provided. Polar bears in the Beaufort Sea and nearby regions den on both the sea ice and on land. Standardized VHF surveys and satellite radio telemetry data provide a general understanding of where polar bears have denned in this region over the past 3 decades. Den observations made during other research activities and anecdotal reports from other government agencies, coastal residents, and industry personnel also are reported. Data on past polar bear maternal den locations are provided to inform the public and to provide information for natural resource agencies in planning activities to avoid or minimize interference with polar bear maternity dens.
descript.purpose: The data were collected on maternal denning by polar bears that use the Beaufort and Chukchi seas. The data have been used to explain polar bear maternal denning including the distribution and timing of maternal denning, the choice of denning substrates (i.e., land versus sea ice), reproductive success, changes in maternal den distribution relative to sea ice change, and (in the case of terrestrial dens) map the land forms selected by bears for maternal denning. In general the data have been used to explain polar bear ecology and to inform management agencies (e.g., the US Fish and Wildlife Service).

spdom.descgeog: Beaufort Sea and Chukchi Sea of northern Alaska, Canada, and Russia

citeinfo.title: Integrated Taxonomic Information System

taxonsys.taxonpro: Identified in the field by scientists.

idinfo.accconst: None. Please see 'Distribution Info' for details.
idinfo.useconst: None. Users are advised to read the data set's metadata thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations.
idinfo.datacred: The authors recognize the contributions of Gerald Garner (ASC, deceased) who deployed satellite collars on female polar bears in the Chukchi Sea between 1987 and 1994. We also recognize the contributions of numerous local residents and industry personnel whose observations added to the data in this report. Primary funding for this work was provided by the USGS. Additional support was provided by the USFWS, British Petroleum Exploration – Alaska, ConocoPhillips – Alaska, ExxonMobil, Polar Bears International, the World Wildlife Fund, and prior to 1973, the State of Alaska.
idinfo.native: Environment as of Metadata Creation: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 10.1 (Build 3035) Service Pack 1 (Build 3143)

attracc.attraccr: Some, but not all, dens were visited on the ground and their location was determined with GPS or with USGS topographic maps (1:63,000). Some dens were not visited on the ground and their locations were determined solely by satellite telemetry or by conventional VHF telemetry. Dens reported to USGS by others were infrequently revisited.

dataqual.logic: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted.
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details. Users are cautioned that observations of maternal dens are dependent on the method of data collection; thus, certain methods may provide a better representation of den distribution than others.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.

method.methdesc: Conventional – Encountered during other ASC polar bear field research efforts
Report – Reported to Alaska Science Center from other individuals or agencies
VHF_RADIO – encountered through very high frequency (VHF) telemetry

procstep.procdesc: Development of the data set by the agency / individuals identified in the 'Originator' element in the Identification Info section of the record.

enttyp.enttypd: Table containing attribute information associated with the data set.

attr.attrdef: The most recent date the data originator updated or verified the record, expressed in the standard ISO 8601:2004(E).

The date and time value of the modified term, recorded in the exact format that the data originator provided it, for purposes of audit trail, since OBIS-USA will convert this to ISO 8601:2004(E) for operational purposes.
An abbreviated name for the dataset that contains the occurrence record.

edom.edomvd: United States Geological Survey Alaska Science Center Polar Bear Maternal Dens

attr.attrdef: Institution codes, in the form of abbreviated institution names, separated by semicolons, that define the hierarchy of institutions within which the data originator operates. Includes the originating institution as the lowest level (rightmost) code.

edom.edomvd: Department of the Interior; United States Geological Survey

attr.attrdef: An abbreviation for the institution that is the originator of this data resource; the institution involved in research, data collection and/or data management that most directly produced this dataset.
An abbreviation that identifies the institution, within the higherInstitutionCode hierarchy, that is considered the owner or controller of the data.
An identifier for a subset(s) of data within the dataset, partitioned by methods or parameters meaningful to the data originators.
A record identifier provided by the data originator.
The date and time of observation expressed in local time using the standard ISO 8601:2004(E).
The time zone of the observation event, expressed as +/- hh:mm offset from UTC.
Explains information about date and time that may not be evident in verbatim, ISO 8601, or nominal forms of the date and time.
The expression of the date and time of the observation in language identical to the originator's description of the date and time of observation.
This term identifies a specific instant chosen to represent the date and time of the observation, in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

This is the uncertainty in seconds before and after the (the term) time, as a result of both precision and accuracy factors in determining observation time. This use of uncertainty makes (the term) time the mid-point in the range of uncertainty equal to twice the value of this term.
The position of the observation north or south of the equator in decimal degrees.
The position of the observation east or west of the prime meridian in decimal degrees.
A Well-Known Text (WKT) representation of geometry associated with the observation.
An expression in meters of the overall uncertainty of the georeference provided by the latitude and longitude data.
Record original coordinate information here (both latitude and longitude) for audit trail purposes where necessary.
The spatial coordinate system for the verbatimCoordinates.
The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which coordinates given in verbatimCoordinates are based.
The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system used in (the terms) latitude and longitude.
The name or other identifier of individual(s) or institution(s) that determined the georeference.

A description or reference to the methods used to determine the spatial footprint, coordinates, and uncertainties. Georeference methods, including determination of coordinates and uncertainty, should be explained in metadata.

edom.edomvd: Encountered during other Alaska Science Center polar bear field research efforts
Reported to Alaska Science Center from other individuals or agencies

attr.attrdef: minimumElevationInMeters and maximumElevationInMeters express the elevation range in which the observation was made.
minimumElevationInMeters and maximumElevationInMeters express the elevation range in which the observation was made.
minimumDepthInMeters and maximumDepthInMeters express the depth range in which the observation was made.
minimumDepthInMeters and maximumDepthInMeters express the depth range in which the observation was made.
Identifies the source of information or observation that generated the biological occurrence record.

edom.edomvd: Observation made by a human observer

attr.attrdef: The name or other identifier of individual(s) or institution(s) responsible for making the observation and recording it in electronic form.

edom.edomvd: Alaska Department of Fish and Game
Residents of coastal villages and homesteads
United States Fish and Wildlife Service, Marine Mammals Management

attr.attrdef: Literature citation for when the occurrence record is derived from literature.
The name of an institution also involved in gathering or developing this data, in between the data originator and OBIS-USA.

edom.edomvd: United States Geological Survey; Alaska Science Center

attr.attrdef: URL provided by the data originator that links to a resource specific to this individual record, for example, an image file or web page devoted to this observation.
This term is only used as a companion to the originatorResourceUrl term. The label term contains the label information to be displayed to a web user in relation to the corresponding URL.
A common or vernacular name for the taxon observed.

The taxonomic identification of the observation as either 1) Genus and species (and subspecies if provided) in Latin binomial nomenclature form, or 2) the lowest-level taxonomic name to which the observation is identified, expressed in Latin form.
taxonRank identifies the taxonomic level of the lowest-level name in the scientificName term, if the scientificName refers to a level above genus.

edom.edomvd: Species that are recorded at the species level in the taxonomic hierarchy

attr.attrdef: A list (concatenated and separated by semicolons) of nomenclatural types (type status, typified scientific name, publication) applied to the subject.
The full scientific name of the genus in which the taxon is classified.
The full scientific name of the subgenus in which the taxon is classified.
The full scientific name of the species in which the taxon is classified.
The full scientific name of the subspecies, variant or other finer level identification.
The authorship information for the scientificName.
The name or other identifier of individual(s) or institution(s) that assigned the taxonomic name.
The date the identification on this record was made, expressed in ISO 8601 date format.
A brief phrase or a standard term ("cf.", "aff.") to express the determiner's uncertainty about the identification.

Comments or notes about the identification, including any applicable reference to process, authorities, keys, uncertainties, or special conventions used in making the identification and assigning the name and/or formatting the name.
The number of individuals represented in the observation record.
The recorded weight in kilograms of the individuals in the observation.
The sex of biological individuals represented in the observation record.
An expression or description of age or lifestage of biological individual(s) in the observation record.
A list (concatenated and separated by semicolons) of preparations and preservation methods for a specimen.
Information, that is not addressed elsewhere in MBG, about the observation event and biological or other context details about what was observed.
An identifier for a recognizable individual or group of individuals potentially being observed more than once.

The identifier of any form of technology used in tracking an individual, such as a satellite or radio transceiver, that helps document how the observation was made and known to be a consistent individual.
trackHomeRecord identifies the single record and location to consider home for the individual or group identified by the individualID.

The combination of individuaID and the eventDate should capture information about multiple observations as well as the sequence of observations, representing the track covered by the individual. The sequence number term will be generated, in coordination with the data originator, as a series of ordinal integers
surveyEventID identifies a tow, trawl, cast, cruise, transect or other event or unit that survey operators, data gatherers and data managers want to treat as a single consistent event or unit.

A unique identifier for a unit of material, or other medium of observation, gathered at a discrete point in time, that serves as a sample for a survey of biological occurrence (presence, quantification, absence, or derived value).

If a sample is further divided by the data originator for purposes of organization, handling, or analysis, and if the data originator wants to maintain the identity of the subsample, capture the ID of the subsample here.
Identifies the equipment or type of equipment used to obtain or gather the sample or otherwise make the observation.
Information about the intended sampling method as defined by the data originator.

edom.edomvd: Encountered during other ASC polar bear field research efforts
Reported to ASC from other individuals or agencies

attr.attrdef: Information about the extent, duration or other variable aspects of the sampling activity, as conducted by the data originator, that occurred at the time of the sampling event.
Information about the state of the sampling location, determined by external factors such as weather, water conditions, lighting and visibility, etc., at the time of the sampling event.
A description or identifier of general information about the habitat in which the observation was made.
This is a one-character string with enumerated values indicating what type of quantification this record represents.

The names for derived values, referred to as quantification, can be drawn from a controlled vocabulary or vocabularies of quantification names. Or they can be reported using the verbatim name given by the data originator. Either the name of the controlled vocabulary or the word “verbatim” should be used in this term to record the level of control over names.
A name for a derived value or processed data about the occurrence, for example, "Biomass".
The value of the derived information product, such as the numerical value for biomass. This term does not include units. Units are contained in another term.
The units in which the value expresses the quantification
An estimate of the uncertainty, positive and negative (+/-) offset of the stated value, that expresses the uncertainty of the value as calculated and reported.
The date the quantification was determined, expressed in ISO 8601 date format.
The name or ID of person(s) or institution(s) that determined the quantification.
A reference to the method used to determine the quantification.
The name of the water body in which the observation was made.
The name of an island group associated with the location where the observation was made.
The name of an island associated with the location where the observation was made.
The locality is the most specific named place to identify the location of the observation.
The name of the country in which the observation location occurs.
The name of the state or province in which the observation location occurs.
The name of the county or other comparable geographic unit in which the observation location occurs.
The name of the municipality in which the observation location occurs.
The full scientific name of the kingdom in which the taxon is classified.
The full scientific name of the phylum in which the taxon is classified.
The full scientific name of the class in which the taxon is classified.
The full scientific name of the order in which the taxon is classified.
The full scientific name of the family in which the taxon is classified.

overview.eaover: The entity and attribute information provided here describes the tabular data associated with the data set. Please review the detailed descriptions that are provided (the individual attribute descriptions) for information on the values that appear as fields/table entries of the data set.
overview.eadetcit: The entity and attribute information was generated by the individual and/or agency identified as the originator of the data set. Please review the rest of the metadata record for additional details and information.
